messages.message: How long did you not use it for? When we removed instabase personal forks, we automatically deleted any sandbox that was created from a fork instead of instabase/instabase
I dint use it for last 10 days
Also seeing that my sandboxes disappeared :cry:
oo this seems like a new issue then :disappointed:

Hey there! Couple points/questions from myself:
• @lydia crafting "sandbox" != instabase "sandbox" -- a crafting sandbox is a virtual machine, an instabase sandbox is an EKS cluster with instabase deployed to it
• This is most likely related to crafting's automatic purging of "stale" sandboxes, which is currently set to two weeks
• We most likely are seeing this surfaced now due to the holiday break -- I've bumped the retention to 1 month for now
• Is there a specific retention period that people would prefer we set going forward?

Yup, I assumed we were talking about crafting sandboxes, since this is in the <#C05L87V014J|> channel. My crafting sandbox connected to my personal fork of instabase was deleted when we moved away from forks. I assumed that was related, but maybe it was just hitting the 2-week retention period.

My sandbox was definitely not deleted when we moved away from forks instead it must be the 2 weeks time period since I was using 2 sandboxes one with ppy and other without. For my use case 2 weeks is pretty less since I use one sandbox for frontend and other for backend where it might be a month long gap between their use.
